contentrichtext.text: '''Nicolai Ouroussoff''' (born October 3, 1962) was the architecture critic for ''[[The New York Times]]'' from 2004 until June 2011. ==Biography== Born in [[Boston]], Massachusetts United States, he received a bachelor’s degree in Russian from Georgetown University and a master’s degree from the Columbia University Graduate School of Architecture The protégé of the late [[Herbert Muschamp]], Ouroussoff replaced his mentor as ''[[New York Times]]'' architecture critic in 2004. He wrote the newspaper's obituary for Muschamp in 2007.<ref>{{cite news |title=Herbert Muschamp, Architecture Critic, Is Dead |first=Nicolai |last=Ouroussoff |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2007/10/03/arts/design/03cnd-muschamp.html |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |date=October 3, 2007 |accessdate=2010-03-04}}</ref> Previously, Ouroussoff had been the architecture critic for the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'', for which he was a nominated finalist for a [[Pulitzer Prize]] in 2004.
